snippet: Despite administration officials’ statements that their strong preference is for capturing terrorists, a reliance on killing terrorism suspects has defined the Obama years.
abstract: Case of Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, high-level terrorist suspect awaiting trial after seizure by America's counter-terrorism officials, offers rare example where Obama administration has captured a terrorist instead of killing them; despite protestations by officials, statistics show that government is more likely to use lethal force against terrorists than less-convenient capture (Series: Rise of the Predators).
lead_paragraph: Despite administration officials’ statements that their strong preference is for capturing terrorists, a reliance on killing terrorism suspects has defined the Obama years.

headline.print_headline: Targeted Killing Comes to Define War on Terror
headline.seo: Targeted Killing Comes to Define War on Terror
headline.main: Targeted Killing Comes to Define War on Terror
